main event: A sighting of an unidentified object by Sgt. Douglas J. Lawson in Reno, Nevada on June 12, 1959.
interesting points: The object was described as silvery grey and approximately the size of a quarter held at arm's length,The object was observed at an estimated altitude of 2,000 to 2,200 feet over the Sierra Mountain range,The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes with no discernible sound,The observer, Sgt. Lawson, is described as an experienced officer with a background in aircraft maintenance,The report suggests the possibility that the sighted object could have been a large weather balloon released around the time of the sighting.
witness description: Sergeant Douglas J. Lawson, an excellent officer, relaxed and happy in his job, married, reliable and stable.
